description: Number of terms in base 3 representation of 2^n.
comments: a(n) = A081604(A000079(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 12 2011For n>0, first differences of A022331. - _Michel Marcus_, Oct 03 2013a(A020914(n)) = n + 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 28 2015
links: William A. Tedeschi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: Table[Length[IntegerDigits[2^n,3]],{n,0,80}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 02 2012 *)Table[1 + Floor[n*Log[3, 2]], {n, 0, 73}] (* _L. Edson Jeffery_, Dec 04 2015 *)
prog: (Haskell)a020915 = a081604 . a000079  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 28 2015(PARI) a(n)=logint(2^n,3)+1 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 02 2015(MAGMA) [Round(1+Floor(n*(Log(2))/Log(3))): n in [0..80]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Dec 05 2015
